content.question:
TABLE 1. PERCENT HOMOLOGY OF <math alttext="M E F 2 A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi><mi>E</mi><mi>F</mi><mn mathvariant="italic">2</mn><mi>A</mi></math> NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCES

Species
M. radiata
C. jacchus
S. scrofa
C. carpio
R. temporaria

M. radiata

<math alttext="90.3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90.3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="71.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>71.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="42.7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42.7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="50.9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50.9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

C. jacchus

<math alttext="70.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>70.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="42.1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="50.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

S. scrofa

<math alttext="40.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40.8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="48.9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>48.9</mn></math>

C. carpio

<math alttext="44.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>44.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

R. temporaria

The <math alttext="M E F 2 A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi><mi>E</mi><mi>F</mi><mn mathvariant="italic">2</mn><mi>A</mi></math> gene is critical for muscle development in many vertebrates. A researcher sequenced the <math alttext="M E F 2 A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi><mi>E</mi><mi>F</mi><mn mathvariant="italic">2</mn><mi>A</mi></math> gene from five vertebrate species and calculated the percent homology between the nucleotide sequences from each pair of species (Table 1).

Which of the following cladograms is the most accurate representation of the data in Table 1 ?

choices.label: The figure shows a cladogram. The base of the cladogram is divided into three branches at the leftmost node. The top branch is further divided into two branches, one labeled M. radiata and the other labeled C. jacchus. The middle branch is labeled S. Scrofa. The bottom branch of the leftmost node is further divided into two branches, one labeled R. temporaria and the other labeled C. carpio.

The figure shows a cladogram. The base of the cladogram is divided into two branches at the leftmost node. The top branch is further divided into two branches. One of the branches is labeled S. scrofa and the other branch is further divided into two branches, one labeled M. radiata and the other labeled C. jacchus. The bottom branch of the leftmost node is further divided into two branches, one labeled R. temporaria and the other labeled C. carpio.

The figure shows a cladogram. The base of the cladogram is divided into two branches at the leftmost node. The top branch is labeled C. carpio. The bottom branch of the leftmost node is further divided into two branches. The top branch is labeled R. temporaria. The lower branch is further divided into two branches. The top branch is labeled S. scrofa and the bottom branch is further divided into two branches, one labeled M. radiata and the other labeled C. jacchus.

The figure shows a cladogram. The base of the cladogram is divided into two branches at the leftmost node. The top branch is further divided into two branches, one labeled C. carpio and the other labeled R. temporaria. The bottom branch is further divided into three branches, one labeled S. scrofa, one labeled M. radiata, and one labeled C. jacchus.

content.answer: The figure shows a cladogram. The base of the cladogram is divided into two branches at the leftmost node. The top branch is labeled C. carpio. The bottom branch of the leftmost node is further divided into two branches. The top branch is labeled R. temporaria. The lower branch is further divided into two branches. The top branch is labeled S. scrofa and the bottom branch is further divided into two branches, one labeled M. radiata and the other labeled C. jacchus.

skill.text: 2.B: Explain relationships between characteristics of biological models in both theoretical and applied contexts.
